meanings.definition: The quality or characteristic of being timid or cowardly.
meanings.sent1: His sissyness showed when he refused to go into the haunted house.
meanings.sent2: The kitten's sissyness was evident as it hid from the loud noise.
meanings.sent3: Despite his sissyness, he still managed to face his fear of spiders.
meanings.sent4: The sissyness of the mouse made it an easy target for the cat.
meanings.sent5: The sissyness of the puppy was endearing to everyone who met him.

meanings.definition: Behavior or traits considered effeminate or weak.
meanings.sent1: His sissyness was evident in the way he delicately held the teacup.
meanings.sent2: The boy was teased for his sissyness because he enjoyed dancing.
meanings.sent3: Despite his sissyness, he excelled in painting and poetry.
meanings.sent4: The sissyness of his voice made him the target of jokes among his friends.
meanings.sent5: Her sissyness was seen as a unique and beautiful aspect of her personality.

meanings.definition: A derogatory term for a man perceived as weak or unmanly.
meanings.sent1: He was hurt by the use of the term 'sissyness' to describe him.
meanings.sent2: The bully used sissyness to belittle the boy in front of his classmates.
meanings.sent3: Despite the teasing, he never let the sissyness label affect his confidence.
meanings.sent4: The sissyness insult only fueled his determination to prove them wrong.
meanings.sent5: His sissyness was just a small part of who he truly was as a person.
